title: How to Change Your Desktop Wallpaper on Linux Mint

steps.title: Obtain the picture you want for your wallpaper.
steps.content: Obtain the picture you want for your wallpaper. Save it on your computer. If you choose an image from online, just right-click on the image and select "Set as Desktop Background..."

steps.title: Right-click on the image.
steps.content: Right-click on the image. Select "Set as Wallpaper..."

steps.title: Click on your Start menu, and click on "System Settings".
steps.content: Click on your Start menu, and click on "System Settings". Click on "Backgrounds."

steps.title: Select the picture you want by clicking on it.
steps.content: Select the picture you want by clicking on it. You now can choose from a variety of pictures provided by Linux Mint, and you can access your "Pictures" folder, too. To add a specific folder for easy access, click the + button on the bottom of the list. To remove one, select the folder, then click the - button.

steps.title: Open Terminal.
steps.content: Open Terminal. You will need to make sure that your wallpaper is set to default beforehand.

steps.title: Enter the command into the Terminal.
steps.content: Enter the command into the Terminal. Copy the following command, and right click in Terminal and select 'Paste' to paste the following command: gsettings get org.gnome.desktop.background picture-uri ,Then press â†µ Enter .

steps.title: Select the file address that is given.
steps.content: Select the file address that is given. Right-click the selected text and click "Copy".

steps.title: Open your "home" (or any other) folder, and click on the "Toggle Location Entry" button, Then paste the file path into the address bar.
steps.content: Open your "home" (or any other) folder, and click on the "Toggle Location Entry" button, Then paste the file path into the address bar.

steps.title: Replace the "default_background.jpg" shortcut with your picture.
steps.content: Replace the "default_background.jpg" shortcut with your picture. Rename the picture to "default_background.jpg" (make sure the image is in a .JPG/.JPEG format). This will replace the Linux Mint default image.
